name: Spaghetti Bolognese
description: Classic Italian pasta with rich meat sauce
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Cook onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and brown, breaking it up with a spoon.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add canned tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Serve pasta topped with sauce and parmesan cheese.

name: Chicken Curry
description: Aromatic and creamy Indian-style chicken curry
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook onion until golden, about 8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add curry powder, cumin, and turmeric. Stir for 30 seconds.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink on the outside.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Cook for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce thickens.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over steamed rice.

name: Caesar Salad
description: Crisp romaine lettuce with classic Caesar dressing and croutons
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut bread into cubes, toss with 2 tbsp olive oil and minced garlic.
Bake croutons for 10-12 minutes until golden.
Wash and chop romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
Make dressing: whisk together mayonnaise, remaining olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Toss lettuce with dressing.
Top with croutons and shaved parmesan.
Serve immediately.

name: Miso Honey Glazed Salmon
description: Tender salmon fillets with a sweet and savory miso glaze
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Whisk together miso paste, honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, minced garlic, ginger, and sesame oil.
Place salmon fillets on a lined baking sheet.
Brush half the glaze generously over the salmon.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until salmon flakes easily.
Meanwhile, cook rice according to package directions.
Brush salmon with remaining glaze and broil for 2 minutes until caramelized.
Serve over rice, garnished with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.

name: Korean Beef Bowls
description: Quick and flavorful ground beef with a sweet-spicy Korean sauce
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.
Mix soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, ginger, and gochujang in a bowl.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
Drain excess fat if needed.
Pour sauce over beef and stir to coat. Simmer for 3-4 minutes.
Slice cucumber into thin rounds and chop green onions.
Serve beef over rice, topped with cucumber, green onions, and sesame seeds.

name: Coconut Shrimp with Mango Salsa
description: Crispy coconut-crusted shrimp with fresh tropical mango salsa
instructions: Dice mango, red onion, jalapeno, and cilantro. Mix with lime juice and a pinch of salt for salsa.
Set up breading station: flour in one bowl, beaten eggs in another, coconut in a third.
Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Dredge each shrimp in flour, dip in egg, then coat in coconut.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 350°F (175°C).
Fry shrimp in batches for 2-3 minutes until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve crispy shrimp with mango salsa on the side.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender chicken in a creamy spiced tomato sauce
instructions: Cut chicken into chunks and marinate in yogurt with half the spices for 30 minutes.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Heat butter in a large pan and cook marinated chicken until charred.
Remove chicken and sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic, ginger, and remaining spices. Cook for 1 minute.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and return chicken to the pan.
Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Serve over rice with fresh cilantro.

name: Beef Fajita Bowls
description: Sizzling beef strips with peppers and onions over rice
instructions: Slice beef into thin strips and season with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Slice peppers and onion into strips.
Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Sear beef strips for 2 minutes per side, then set aside.
Sauté peppers and onion until slightly charred.
Return beef to pan with minced garlic and lime juice.
Serve over rice with sour cream and cilantro.

name: Teriyaki Chicken
description: Glazed chicken thighs with homemade teriyaki sauce
instructions: Mix soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger for the sauce.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Steam broccoli until tender-crisp.
Pan-fry chicken thighs skin-side down until crispy.
Flip and cook through, about 6 minutes per side.
Pour sauce over chicken and simmer until glazed.
Serve chicken over rice with broccoli.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
description: Rich and creamy Italian rice with sautéed mushrooms
instructions: Heat stock in a saucepan and keep warm.
Sauté mushrooms in butter until golden, set aside.
In the same pan, cook onion in olive oil until soft.
Add garlic and rice, toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Add stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Continue for 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy.
Fold in mushrooms, parmesan, and thyme.
Serve immediately with extra parmesan.

name: Crispy Fish Tacos
description: Beer-battered fish with tangy slaw in soft tortillas
instructions: Make batter by whisking flour and beer until smooth.
Shred cabbage and mix with mayo, lime juice, and chipotle for slaw.
Cut fish into strips and season with salt.
Heat oil to 375°F (190°C).
Dip fish in batter and fry until golden, about 3 minutes.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan.
Assemble tacos with fish, slaw, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges.

name: Sweet and Spicy Pork Stir Fry
description: Tender pork with vegetables in a sticky sweet-spicy sauce
instructions: Slice pork into thin strips and toss with cornstarch.
Mix soy sauce, honey, and sriracha for the sauce.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat.
Stir-fry pork until browned, set aside.
Stir-fry peppers and snap peas for 2 minutes.
Return pork, add garlic and sauce.
Toss until glossy and serve over rice.

name: Greek Chicken Bowls
description: Mediterranean chicken with cucumber, tomatoes, and tzatziki
instructions: Marinate chicken in olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and garlic.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Make tzatziki by mixing yogurt, grated cucumber, garlic, and lemon.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through.
Dice cucumber, halve tomatoes, and slice red onion.
Slice chicken and arrange over rice.
Top with vegetables, feta, and tzatziki.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

name: Garlic Shrimp Scampi
description: Succulent shrimp in a buttery garlic white wine sauce
instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions, reserve pasta water.
Heat olive oil and half the butter in a large pan.
Sauté shrimp until pink, about 2 minutes per side, set aside.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook for 30 seconds.
Pour in wine and lemon juice, simmer for 2 minutes.
Add remaining butter and toss with pasta.
Return shrimp to pan and add pasta water if needed.
Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

name: BBQ Glazed Chicken
description: Juicy chicken with smoky homemade BBQ glaze
instructions: Mix ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, worcestershire, paprika, and garlic powder for BBQ sauce.
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Grill or bake chicken at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.
Brush with BBQ sauce and cook 10 more minutes.
Grill or boil corn until tender.
Mix coleslaw with mayonnaise.
Brush chicken with more sauce before serving.
Serve with corn and coleslaw.

name: Vegetable Pad Thai
description: Classic Thai noodles with vegetables and tangy sauce
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes, drain.
Mix tamarind, fish sauce, and brown sugar for the sauce.
Press and cube tofu, then pan-fry until golden.
Push tofu aside, scramble eggs in the same pan.
Add noodles and sauce, toss to coat.
Add bean sprouts and green onions.
Serve topped with crushed peanuts and lime wedges.

name: Lamb Kofta with Mint Yogurt
description: Spiced lamb skewers with cool mint yogurt sauce
instructions: Mix lamb with grated onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Form mixture around skewers into oval shapes.
Mix yogurt with chopped mint and a pinch of salt.
Grill kofta for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally.
Warm pita bread on the grill.
Slice cucumber and halve tomatoes.
Serve kofta in pita with vegetables and mint yogurt.

name: Cajun Shrimp Pasta
description: Creamy pasta with spicy Cajun-seasoned shrimp
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Season shrimp with Cajun seasoning.
Sauté shrimp in butter until pink, set aside.
Cook diced bell pepper until soft.
Add garlic, cook for 30 seconds.
Pour in cream and simmer until slightly thickened.
Toss with pasta, shrimp, and parmesan.
Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Honey Garlic Pork Chops
description: Pan-seared pork chops with sticky honey garlic glaze
instructions: Season pork chops with salt and pepper.
Sear in olive oil for 4 minutes per side, set aside.
Add butter and minced garlic to the pan.
Stir in honey and soy sauce, simmer for 2 minutes.
Return pork chops and coat with glaze.
Steam green beans until tender.
Prepare mashed potatoes.
Serve pork over mash with beans and extra glaze.

name: Creamy Tuscan Chicken
description: Chicken in a sun-dried tomato and spinach cream sauce
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Season and sear chicken until golden, set aside.
Sauté garlic in the same pan for 30 seconds.
Add sun-dried tomatoes and Italian seasoning.
Pour in cream and simmer for 3 minutes.
Add spinach and stir until wilted.
Slice chicken and return to sauce.
Stir in parmesan and serve over pasta.

name: Beef Bulgogi
description: Korean marinated beef with sweet and savory flavors
instructions: Slice beef very thin against the grain.
Blend pear, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, garlic, and ginger for marinade.
Marinate beef for at least 1 hour.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Grill or pan-fry beef over high heat until caramelized.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve over rice with kimchi if desired.

name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
description: Juicy roasted chicken with bright lemon and fresh herbs
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Mix olive oil, lemon zest, juice, herbs, and minced garlic.
Rub chicken with herb mixture and season with salt and pepper.
Quarter potatoes and toss with olive oil.
Roast chicken and potatoes for 35 minutes.
Add asparagus and roast 10 more minutes.
Rest chicken for 5 minutes before serving.
Serve with pan juices drizzled over.

name: Thai Basil Chicken
description: Aromatic stir-fried chicken with Thai basil and chilies
instructions: Cook jasmine rice according to package directions.
Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and sugar.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat.
Fry chilies and garlic for 30 seconds.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through.
Pour in sauce and toss to coat.
Remove from heat and fold in Thai basil.
Serve immediately over rice.

name: Salmon Teriyaki Bowl
description: Glazed salmon over rice with edamame and pickled ginger
instructions: Cook sushi rice according to package directions.
Mix soy sauce, mirin, and honey for teriyaki sauce.
Pan-sear salmon skin-side up for 3 minutes.
Flip and cook 3 more minutes, then glaze with sauce.
Cook edamame in salted water.
Slice avocado and cut nori into strips.
Assemble bowls with rice, salmon, edamame, avocado, and ginger.
Top with sesame seeds and nori.

name: Moroccan Spiced Chicken
description: Aromatic chicken with preserved lemons and olives
instructions: Season chicken with cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Brown chicken in a tagine or Dutch oven.
Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add saffron and stock, bring to simmer.
Return chicken, add preserved lemons and olives.
Cover and cook for 30 minutes.
Prepare couscous according to package directions.
Serve chicken over couscous with cilantro.

name: Spicy Black Bean Tacos
description: Hearty vegetarian tacos with seasoned black beans
instructions: Drain and rinse black beans.
Mash half the beans, leave half whole.
Season beans with cumin, chipotle, salt, and lime juice.
Warm in a pan until heated through.
Mash avocado with lime juice and salt.
Char tortillas over an open flame or in a dry pan.
Fill tortillas with beans, guacamole, onion, and cheese.
Top with salsa verde and cilantro.

name: Ginger Beef Stir Fry
description: Crispy beef strips with fresh ginger and vegetables
instructions: Slice beef thin and toss with cornstarch.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, and brown sugar.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Fry beef in batches until crispy, set aside.
Stir-fry peppers until tender-crisp.
Add ginger and garlic, cook 30 seconds.
Return beef and add sauce, toss until glazed.
Serve immediately over rice.

name: Crispy Chicken Parmesan
description: Breaded chicken cutlets with marinara and melted cheese
instructions: Pound chicken to even thickness.
Set up breading: flour, beaten eggs, breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan.
Bread chicken cutlets.
Pan-fry in olive oil until golden on both sides.
Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Place chicken in baking dish, top with marinara and mozzarella.
Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden.
Serve over spaghetti with fresh basil.

name: Coconut Curry Soup
description: Warming Thai-inspired soup with vegetables and rice noodles
instructions: Cube and pan-fry tofu until golden.
Sauté curry paste in a pot for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk and stock, bring to simmer.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes.
Add rice noodles and bok choy.
Cook until noodles are tender.
Season with fish sauce and lime juice.
Serve topped with tofu and cilantro.

name: Mediterranean Grain Bowl
description: Quinoa bowl with hummus, falafel, and fresh vegetables
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Bake or pan-fry falafel until heated through.
Dice cucumber and halve tomatoes.
Slice red onion thinly.
Fluff quinoa and divide among bowls.
Top with falafel, vegetables, feta, and olives.
Add a generous scoop of hummus.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.

name: Sesame Crusted Tuna
description: Seared ahi tuna with sesame crust and wasabi aioli
instructions: Mix wasabi paste with mayonnaise for aioli.
Press sesame seeds onto all sides of tuna.
Heat sesame oil in a pan over high heat.
Sear tuna for 30 seconds per side for rare.
Whisk soy sauce, rice vinegar, and ginger for dressing.
Toss greens with dressing.
Slice tuna and arrange over greens.
Drizzle with wasabi aioli.

name: Butter Chicken
description: Rich and creamy Indian chicken in tomato-butter sauce
instructions: Cut chicken into chunks and season with spices.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Brown chicken in butter, set aside.
Sauté onion until golden, add garlic.
Add tomato puree and spices, simmer 15 minutes.
Stir in cream and return chicken.
Simmer until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with rice and warm naan, garnished with cilantro.

name: Creamy Pesto Pasta
description: Pasta tossed with fresh basil pesto and cherry tomatoes
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions, reserve pasta water.
Blend basil, pine nuts, parmesan, garlic, and olive oil for pesto.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Toss hot pasta with pesto and cream.
Add pasta water to loosen if needed.
Fold in cherry tomatoes and lemon juice.
Top with extra parmesan and basil.
Serve immediately.

name: Chicken Shawarma Wraps
description: Spiced chicken with garlic sauce in warm pita
instructions: Mix spices with olive oil and marinate chicken for 1 hour.
Blend yogurt with half the garlic and lemon juice for sauce.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until charred and cooked through.
Slice chicken into strips.
Warm pita bread.
Layer chicken, lettuce, tomato, and pickled turnips in pita.
Drizzle generously with garlic sauce.
Wrap and serve immediately.

name: Shrimp Fried Rice
description: Classic Chinese-style fried rice with shrimp and vegetables
instructions: Dice carrots and slice green onions.
Scramble eggs in a wok, set aside.
Stir-fry shrimp until pink, set aside.
Add oil, stir-fry carrots and peas.
Add cold rice and break up clumps.
Push rice aside, cook garlic briefly.
Add soy sauce and toss everything together.
Return eggs and shrimp, add sesame oil and green onions.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Bell peppers filled with seasoned beef and rice
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.
Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds.
Brown beef with onion and garlic.
Add half the tomatoes, seasoning, and cooked rice.
Stuff peppers with beef mixture.
Place in baking dish, pour remaining tomatoes around.
Cover and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 40 minutes.
Top with mozzarella and bake until melted.

name: Crispy Orange Chicken
description: Crispy fried chicken pieces in tangy orange glaze
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Toss chicken with cornstarch.
Mix orange juice, soy sauce, sugar, vinegar, and zest for sauce.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Deep fry chicken until golden and crispy.
Heat sauce in a wok with garlic until thickened.
Toss chicken in sauce until coated.
Serve over rice with green onions.

name: Herb-Crusted Lamb Chops
description: Tender lamb chops with rosemary and garlic crust
instructions: Mix breadcrumbs with rosemary, garlic, and olive oil.
Sear lamb chops for 2 minutes per side.
Brush with mustard and press herb crust on top.
Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 10-12 minutes for medium.
Boil potatoes and mash with butter.
Steam green beans until tender.
Rest lamb for 5 minutes.
Serve with mash and green beans.

name: Classic Chicken Pot Pie
description: Creamy chicken and vegetables under flaky pastry
instructions: Poach chicken in stock, then shred.
Dice carrots, celery, and onion.
Make roux with butter and flour.
Add stock and cream, cook until thickened.
Add vegetables and cook for 5 minutes.
Fold in chicken and thyme, season to taste.
Pour into baking dish, top with pastry.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes until golden.

name: Classic Beef Tacos
description: Seasoned ground beef in crispy shells with fresh toppings
instructions: Brown ground beef with diced onion.
Add cumin, chili powder, salt, and a splash of water.
Simmer until liquid evaporates.
Warm taco shells according to package.
Shred lettuce, dice tomatoes, grate cheese.
Fill shells with beef.
Top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Serve immediately.

name: Pork Ramen Bowl
description: Rich pork broth with noodles, egg, and toppings
instructions: Roast pork belly at 400°F (200°C) for 30 minutes, then slice.
Soft-boil eggs for 6 minutes, then peel.
Simmer stock with garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and miso.
Cook noodles according to package directions.
Divide noodles among bowls.
Ladle hot broth over noodles.
Top with pork, halved eggs, corn, green onions, and nori.
Serve immediately.

name: Chicken Alfredo
description: Creamy parmesan pasta with grilled chicken
instructions: Season chicken with Italian seasoning and grill until cooked.
Cook fettuccine according to package directions.
Melt butter in a large pan, sauté garlic.
Add cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in parmesan until melted and smooth.
Toss pasta in sauce.
Slice chicken and place on top.
Garnish with parsley and black pepper.

name: Korean Bibimbap
description: Rice bowl with vegetables, beef, and gochujang sauce
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.
Julienne carrots and zucchini, sauté separately with sesame oil.
Blanch spinach and bean sprouts, season with sesame oil.
Slice and stir-fry beef with soy sauce.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Arrange rice in bowls, top with vegetables and beef.
Place egg on top and add gochujang.
Mix everything together before eating.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
description: Breaded eggplant slices baked with marinara and cheese
instructions: Slice eggplant into rounds, salt and let drain for 30 minutes.
Set up breading: flour, beaten eggs, breadcrumbs with parmesan.
Bread eggplant slices.
Pan-fry until golden on both sides.
Spread some marinara in a baking dish.
Layer eggplant, marinara, and mozzarella.
Repeat layers and top with cheese.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes until bubbly.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
description: Spicy stir-fried chicken with peanuts and chilies
instructions: Cube chicken and toss with cornstarch.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, and hoisin for sauce.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Toast peanuts in a dry wok, set aside.
Stir-fry chicken until cooked, set aside.
Fry chilies until fragrant.
Add garlic and ginger, then return chicken.
Add sauce and peanuts, toss with green onions.

name: Caprese Stuffed Chicken
description: Chicken breast stuffed with mozzarella, tomato, and basil
instructions: Cut a pocket in each chicken breast.
Season inside and out with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff with mozzarella slices, tomato, and basil.
Secure with toothpicks if needed.
Sear chicken in olive oil for 4 minutes per side.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 15 minutes until cooked through.
Rest for 5 minutes.
Serve over greens with balsamic glaze drizzled on top.

name: Beef Stroganoff
description: Tender beef in creamy mushroom sauce over egg noodles
instructions: Slice beef into thin strips.
Cook noodles according to package directions.
Brown beef in batches, set aside.
Sauté mushrooms and onion in butter.
Add garlic and cook briefly.
Pour in stock and mustard, simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and return beef.
Serve over noodles with parsley.
